pr_title: parse innerExpression and remove sql parameter in SelectStatementContext

timeline.message: parse innerExpression and remove sql parameter in SelectStatementContext

timeline.bodyText: The result of ctx.start.getInputStream().getText() and ctx.getText() are the same?
timeline.author: tristaZero

replies.bodyText:
Do you think ctx.getChild(1)).getSymbol().getStartIndex() == ctx.LP_().getSymbol().getStartIndex()?
From the definition of aggregationFunction ,
aggregationFunction
    : aggregationFunctionName LP_ distinct? (expr (COMMA_ expr)* | ASTERISK_)? RP_
What we want is from LP_ to RP_, right?
replies.author: tristaZero
strongduanmu

replies.bodyText:
Do you think ctx.getChild(1)).getSymbol().getStartIndex() == ctx.LP_().getSymbol().getStartIndex()?

Yes, maybe using ctx.LP_().getSymbol().getStartIndex() is more easier to read. I will optimise it.

From the definition of aggregationFunction ,
aggregationFunction
: aggregationFunctionName LP_ distinct? (expr (COMMA_ expr)* | ASTERISK_)? RP_
What we want is from LP_ to RP_, right?

Yes, the innerExpression include sql string from LP_ to RP_. The previous innerExpressionStartIndex is also the same logic.
replies.author: strongduanmu

timeline.bodyText: Here the check style is out of rule, so you correct them?
timeline.author: tristaZero
